com.orbischallenge.ctz.objects

Class World

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.orbischallenge.game.SidedModel<com.orbischallenge.ctz.objects.interfaces.IWorld>
      • com.orbischallenge.ctz.objects.World

  • public class World
extends com.orbischallenge.game.SidedModel<com.orbischallenge.ctz.objects.interfaces.IWorld>
    Represents a state of the game World. Contains various methods for finding pickups, control points, and navigating.

    Created by Orbis Access (Canada) Ltd on 07/06/2016.

      • getPickups

        public Pickup[] getPickups()
        Returns an array of all the pickups on the map that have not been picked up yet.

      • getPickupAtPosition

        public Pickup getPickupAtPosition(Point position)
        Returns the pickup located at the given coordinates, or null if there is no pickup there.
        Parameters:
        position - The coordinates to check

      • getPositionsOfPickupType

        public Point[] getPositionsOfPickupType(PickupType type)
        Returns all the coordinates of the map that contain a Pickup of the given PickupType. Returns an empty array if there is no such pickup on the field.
        Parameters:
        type - The type of pickup to look for

      • getTile

        public TileType getTile(Point point)
        Returns the type of the tile located at the given point, or null if the given point is outside the world bounds.
        Parameters:
        point - The point to look in.

      • isWithinBounds

        public boolean isWithinBounds(Point point)
        Returns true iff the given point in within world bounds.

      • canMoveFromPointInDirection

        public boolean canMoveFromPointInDirection(Point start,
                                  Direction direction)
        Returns true iff something located at point start could possibly move in the given direction
        Parameters:
        start - The point to start from
        direction - The direction to check

      • getNextDirectionInPath

        public Direction getNextDirectionInPath(Point start,
                               Point destination)
        Gets the next direction in the shortest path from the given start tile to the given destination. Avoids walls, but not units. This function will run extremely quickly if the map has a navigation cache (.nac) file. All maps provided in the game and tournament will have this file. Check the manual for instructions on generating the files for your own custom maps.
        Parameters:
        start - The tile to start from. The returned direction is the direction to move in from this tile.
        destination - The destination tile.
        Returns:
        The direction to move in from the start tile to get to the destination tile. Returns NOWHERE if there is no way to get to the destination or if the start tile is the same as the destination (you are already there).

      • canShooterShootTarget

        public boolean canShooterShootTarget(Point shooter,
                            Point target,
                            int shotRange)
        Returns true iff there is a clear line of fire from Point shooter to Point target. This takes walls into account.
        Parameters:
        shooter - The source of the shot
        target - The target of the shot
        shotRange - Maximum distance in tiles that the bullet can travel

      • getClosestShootableEnemyInDirection

        public EnemyUnit getClosestShootableEnemyInDirection(FriendlyUnit shooter,
                                            Direction direction)
        Finds the closest EnemyUnit in the given Direction that can be shot by the given FriendlyUnit. Takes into account walls, and the FriendlyUnit's shot range.
        Parameters:
        shooter - The FriendlyUnit firing the shot.
        direction - The direction to look in
        Returns:
        The closest EnemyUnit that the FriendlyUnit can shoot, or null if no enemy can be shot in that direction.

      • getNearestControlPoint

        public ControlPoint getNearestControlPoint(Point position)
        Returns the control point with the closest linear distance (i.e. ignoring any obstacles/walls; "as the crow flies") to the given point. If no control points on the map, returns null.
        Parameters:
        position - The point from which to measure distance.

      • getPathLength

        public int getPathLength(Point start,
                Point end)
        Calculates the length of the shortest path from the starting point to the end point.
        Parameters:
        start - The point to start at
        end - The point to end at
        Returns:
        0 if the path does not exist or if the start and end points are the same, otherwise the length of the path (in tiles).
